title: Ticket #4916: Implement "submit many" interface in python bindings
description:
The "submit" interface for the python bindings is not entirely equivalent to condor_submit. It only allows you to set one classad per cluster (note the transaction interface does allow you to at least submit multiple clusters in a single connection).

This is the equivalent of only allowing one "queue N" statement in the submit file. We should provide an interface that is equivalent to having an arbitrary number of "queue N" statements in the python bindings.

I'm thinking: 

int submitMany(ClassAd cluster_ad, list proc_ads, bool spool, list ad_results)
  - ClassAd cluster_ad: The base ad for the entire cluster.  All jobs inherit from this base ad.
  - param proc_ads:  A list of 2-tuples.  The tuples have the format (proc_ad, count).  This will result in "count" jobs being submitted, inheriting from the proc_ad and cluster_ad.
  - param spool: Boolean specifying whether the jobs will be spooled.
  - param ad_results: A list object; the resulting job ads will be appended to this list.
  - return value: The cluster ID.
